student_data.notes: Exact enrollment counts by major are not published on a single live dashboard. Estimates derived from Yale Office of Institutional Research (OIR) 'Degrees Awarded' 2022-23 report. Undergrad CS estimated: (147 CS + 21 Math/CS + 12 Psych/CS) = 180 degrees/year × 4 years = 720. Grad CS (MS) estimated: 67 degrees/year × 2 years = 134. PhD CS estimated: 17 degrees/year × 5.5 years duration = 93.5 (round to 94). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: Available in Grace cluster 'gpu' partition (approx 5 nodes based on older partition dumps).
Available in Grace cluster visualization nodes.

gpu_resources.notes:
Calculations based on YCRC documentation:
1. McCleary Cluster: 32 nodes × 4 A100 80GB = 128 A100 80GB.
2. Palmer Cluster: 3 nodes × 4 A40 = 12 A40.
3. Grace Cluster (Estimates based on partition hardware summaries): 
   - Approx 5 nodes × 4 A100 80GB = 20 A100 80GB.
   - Approx 10 nodes × 4 A100 40GB = 40 A100 40GB.
   - Approx 10 nodes × 4 V100 (32GB) = 40 V100.
   (Note: Grace specific node counts fluctuate as hardware is retired/added; figures are conservative estimates based on reported partition sizes). 

Total A100 80GB = 128 (McCleary) + 20 (Grace) = 148.
Total A100 40GB = 40 (Grace).
Total V100 = 40 (Grace). [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: Yale centralizes high-performance computing under the Yale Center for Research Computing (YCRC). The McCleary cluster is the primary AI/GPU resource (A100s). The new 'Roberts' cluster is mentioned in internal documentation as a secure enclave mirror of McCleary, but public specs were not verifiable enough to include in counts. Student counts are derived from degree conferrals as live enrollment by major is not publicly indexed.
